payload.text:
Execute the directive as specified now.
<directive name="child_write">
<description>Write a message to a file and read it back to verify. Used as a child thread target.</description>
<process>
  <step name="write">
    Write the message to the file:
    `rye_execute(item_type="tool", item_id="rye/file-system/write", parameters={"file_path": "child_output.md", "content": "Hello from the child thread"})`
  </step>

  <step name="verify">
    Read the file back to confirm it was written correctly:
    `rye_execute(item_type="tool", item_id="rye/file-system/read", parameters={"file_path": "child_output.md"})`
  </step>

  <step name="return_result">
    Return the path and the verified content using directive_return.
  </step>
</process>
When you have completed all steps, return structured results:
`rye_execute(item_type="tool", item_id="rye/agent/threads/directive_return", parameters={"path": "<Path to the written file>", "content": "<The content that was verified from reading the file back>"})`
</directive>
I'll execute the child_write directive as specified. Let me proceed through the steps:

payload.output: {'status': 'success', 'type': 'tool', 'item_id': 'rye/file-system/write', 'data': {'success': True, 'output': 'Created new file child_output.md (27 bytes)', 'file_path': 'child_output.md', 'bytes_written': 27, 'created': True}}

Great! The file was written successfully. Now let me read it back to verify:
